alert.note: Alert for Taiya Inlet and Klondike Highway (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Wind Chill Advisory issued January 30 at 10:45PM AKST until January 31 at 12:00PM AKST by NWS Juneau
info.description: ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON AKST MONDAY... ...WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM TUESDAY MORNING THROUGH WEDNESDAY EVENING... * WHAT...For the Wind Chill Advisory, very cold wind chills expected. Wind chills as low as 30 below zero near White Pass. For the Winter Storm Watch, heavy snow possible. Total snow accumulations of 4 to 6 inches or more possible. * WHERE...Taiya Inlet and Klondike Highway including Dyea and Skagway. * WHEN...For the Wind Chill Advisory, from midnight tonight to noon AKST Monday. For the Winter Storm Watch, from Tuesday morning through Wednesday evening. * IMPACTS...The dangerously cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 10 minutes. Travel may be difficult during the heavy snow Tuesday night through Wednesday. A transition to rain is expected at sea level Wednesday night; however confidence on the timing of the change over is low. Heavy snow may persist at higher elevations of the Klondike Highway Wednesday night through the weekend.
info.instruction: Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.
